citation.article-title: Quadricoccus australiensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a beta-proteobacterium from activated sludge biomass.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Quadricoccus (Quad'ri.coc.cus, M.L. quadro four; L. masc. n. coccus sphere; N.L. n. Quadricoccus four spherical cells)
Large Gram-negative, non-spore-forming cocci, 2.2-4.5 μm in diameter, occurring in tetrads, fitting the morphological description of `G-bacteria '.
Cells are aerobic, non-motile and no flagella are observed.
Both poly-P and PHA are synthesized under aerobic conditions of growth. Quadricoccus is oxidase-negative, but catalase-positive.
